title: Techniques...
content:
[hr]Najawa In photoshop; is there a tool to change everything thats one color, into another?
[hr]It's easy enough to do that in Paint:
1. Use the eye-dropper to select the colour you want to replace as the background (ie. right mouse button)
2. Choose the colour you want to replace it with as the foreground (LMB).
3. Select All, Cut
4. LMB Fill
5. Paste and, if it's not already so, enable transparency

[hr]Najawa I'd also like a program that could have Keen's palate to choose from.
[hr]This is also easy to emulate in Paint, though it would indeed be nice if 'twere an actual feature.

1. Open the tileset belonging to the Keen episode in question (I don't know about Dreams, but Keen:Vorticons and :Galaxy have different shades for most colours.

2. Cruise through the bitmap and use the eye dropper to select each 16 colours in turn, drawing a pixel of each in a certain spot. I usually do two rows of eight, surrounded by a white box (as can be seen in the Essence of Mayhem Beta), but it could be more convenient to use a 4x4 box or something.

3a. Copy this box into a new bitmap, and save it somewhere convenient. Copy it from here into any bitmaps you're working on in the future, temporarily resizing them if necessary.

3b. Once again select each of the colours in turn. For each, select 'Edit Colours...' from the Colours menu. Click 'Define Custom Colours >>' and note the values of Red, Green and Blue. With a few moments' effort, the palette can thus be manually adjusted using the acquired list of RGB values.

One of my side projects at the moment is a game art editing utility similar to Paint, but with a more intuitive and streamlined interface. Alas, it remains beyond my coding skill at present, so it'll be a while.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris
